intro: Hevea guianensis var. marginata, commonly known as the Guianan rubber tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant is known for its latex-producing properties, which have been historically used in the rubber industry. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat for various tropical flora and fauna.
